column4: can anyone help me with a CD-ROM problem?  I cannot get data CDs to be read... DVDs read just fine, but not CDs...
I'd like some help
is anyone familiar with my problem?  I cannot read DATA CDs, nothing mounts, if I do "sudo mount /dev/hdb /media/cdrom0" it responds with a message "no media"
yet the media is fine, it works on other computers
these arent blank cds? theyre iso9660 format?
and ALL my data CDs have this problem now... DVDs are fine... haven't tried audo CDs yet
maybe the dev node changed? /dev/hdc or something.. the cd format wouldnt be the problem
how do I find that out?
you could like sudo head /dev/hdc  then try /dev/cdrom etc if it says cannot open its not an associated node im sure there is a better way though
what the hell does sudo head /dev/hdb do?  I just did it and some wierd stuff happened
try "file /dev/hdc" little bit better output
/dev/hdb: block special (3/64)
what does file /dev/hdb say?
lol thats prob it
what does that mean to you?
type "groups"  real quick to make sure youre a member of cdrom or whatever if you are go ahead and do file /dev/hdb real quick to see if thats the correct node
yeah I'm cdrom
if you "file /dev/hdb" does it exist?
ok
and sudo mount -t iso9660 /dev/hdc /media/cdrom0 doesnt work ?
sorry or hdb
thats a new one on me sorry man do udf works but not iso9660..
